Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Interfaces
  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    org.ehcache.expiry.Expiry
    Replaced with ExpiryPolicy that builds on the java.time types.
    org.ehcache.ValueSupplier
    Now using Supplier for ExpiryPolicy
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    org.ehcache.expiry.Duration
    Replaced with Duration
    org.ehcache.expiry.Expirations
    org.ehcache.expiry.Expirations.ExpiryBuilder
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    org.ehcache.config.builders.CacheConfigurationBuilder.add(Builder<? extends ServiceConfiguration<?, ?>>)
    in favor of FluentCacheConfigurationBuilder.withService(Builder)
    org.ehcache.config.builders.CacheConfigurationBuilder.add(ServiceConfiguration<?, ?>)
    in favor of CacheConfigurationBuilder.withService(ServiceConfiguration)
    org.ehcache.config.builders.ConfigurationBuilder.addCache(String, CacheConfiguration<?, ?>)
    in favor of CoreConfigurationBuilder.withCache(String, CacheConfiguration)
    org.ehcache.config.builders.ConfigurationBuilder.addService(ServiceCreationConfiguration<?, ?>)
    in favor of CoreConfigurationBuilder.withService(ServiceCreationConfiguration)
    org.ehcache.expiry.Expirations.builder()
    Use org.ehcache.config.builders.ExpiryPolicyBuilder#expiry() instead
    org.ehcache.config.builders.CacheConfigurationBuilder.clearAllServiceConfig()
    in favor of withoutServices(ServiceConfiguration.class)
    org.ehcache.config.builders.ConfigurationBuilder.containsCache(String)
    in favor of CoreConfigurationBuilder.getCache(String)
    org.ehcache.config.builders.CacheConfigurationBuilder.getExistingServiceConfiguration(Class<T>)
    in favor of FluentCacheConfigurationBuilder.getService(Class)
    org.ehcache.config.builders.CacheConfigurationBuilder.getExistingServiceConfigurations(Class<T>)
    in favor of CacheConfigurationBuilder.getServices(Class)
    org.ehcache.config.CacheConfiguration.getExpiry()
    Use CacheConfiguration.getExpiryPolicy()
    org.ehcache.spi.persistence.StateRepository.getPersistentStateHolder(String, Class<K>, Class<V>)
    Replaced by StateRepository.getPersistentStateHolder(String, Class, Class, Predicate, ClassLoader) that takes in a Predicate that authorizes a class for deserialization
    org.ehcache.event.CacheEvent.getSource()
    org.ehcache.expiry.Expirations.noExpiration()
    Use org.ehcache.config.builders.ExpiryPolicyBuilder#noExpiration() instead
    org.ehcache.config.builders.CacheConfigurationBuilder.remove(ServiceConfiguration<?, ?>)
    in favor of CacheConfigurationBuilder.withoutServices(Class) or CacheConfigurationBuilder.withoutServices(Class, Predicate)
    org.ehcache.config.builders.ConfigurationBuilder.removeCache(String)
    in favor of CoreConfigurationBuilder.withoutCache(String)
    org.ehcache.config.builders.ConfigurationBuilder.removeService(ServiceCreationConfiguration<?, ?>)
    in favor of FluentConfigurationBuilder.withoutServices(Class) or CoreConfigurationBuilder.withoutServices(Class, Predicate)
    org.ehcache.config.builders.CacheManagerBuilder.replacing(ServiceCreationConfiguration<?, ?>)
    in favor of CacheManagerBuilder.using(ServiceCreationConfiguration) whose refined contract matches this one
    org.ehcache.expiry.Expirations.timeToIdleExpiration(Duration)
    Use org.ehcache.config.builders.ExpiryPolicyBuilder#timeToIdleExpiration(java.time.Duration) instead
    org.ehcache.expiry.Expirations.timeToLiveExpiration(Duration)
    Use org.ehcache.config.builders.ExpiryPolicyBuilder#timeToLiveExpiration(java.time.Duration) instead
    org.ehcache.config.builders.CacheConfigurationBuilder.withExpiry(Expiry<? super K, ? super V>)
    Use CacheConfigurationBuilder.withExpiry(ExpiryPolicy) instead
    org.ehcache.config.builders.UserManagedCacheBuilder.withExpiry(Expiry<? super K, ? super V>)
    Use UserManagedCacheBuilder.withExpiry(ExpiryPolicy) instead
